iti22:1.1: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
iti22:2.2: For ‘good deeds’ is a term for happiness, for what is likable, desirable, and agreeable.
iti22:2.3: I recall undergoing for a long time the likable, desirable, and agreeable results of good deeds performed over a long time.
iti22:2.4: As a result, for seven eons of the cosmos contracting and expanding I didn’t return to this world again.
iti22:2.5: As the eon contracted I went to the realm of streaming radiance.
iti22:2.6: As it expanded I was reborn in an empty mansion of Brahmā.
iti22:3.1: There I was Brahmā, the Great Brahmā, the undefeated, the champion, the universal seer, the wielder of power.
iti22:3.2: I was Sakka, lord of gods, thirty-six times.
iti22:3.3: Many hundreds of times I was a king, a wheel-turning monarch, a just and principled king. My dominion extended to all four sides, I achieved stability in the country, and I possessed the seven treasures.
iti22:4.2: ‘Of what deed of mine is this the fruit and result, that I am now so mighty and powerful?’
iti22:4.4: ‘It is the fruit and result of three kinds of deeds:
iti22:4.6: That is what the Buddha said.
iti22:7.1: This too was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.
